content: If a car travels at an average speed of 55 miles per hour for 4.5 hours, how far does it travel?

If a car travels at an average speed of 55 miles per hour for 4.5 hours, the distance it travels can be calculated using the formula:

\[ \text{distance} = \text{speed} \times \text{time} \]

Plugging in the given values:

\[ \text{distance} = 55 \, \text{mph} \times 4.5 \, \text{hours} \]

\[ \text{distance} = 247.5 \, \text{miles} \]

So, the car travels 247.5 miles.
